text:
QUESTION 53) Gone are the time when it was possible to show an economic world organized in well-defined layers, where large urban centers were linked by themselves to the adjacent “slow” economies, with the much faster pace of commerce and Long range finances. Today everything happens as if these overlapping layers were mixed and interpreted. Short and long range interdependencies can no longer be separated from each other.
Brenner, N. Globalization as reterritorialization. Cadernos metropolis, the greatest complexity of contemporary urban spaces stressed in the text is explained by
A) Expansion of metropolitan areas.
B) emancipation of new municipalities.
C) Consolidation of legal domains.
D) Articulation of multiescar networks.
E) redefinition of administrative regions.
